Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlsrocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite. It was very nice to have a full kitchen in the room. The furniture could use a little updating some of it is getting old and tired. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The AC worked very well. Most of the staff was helpful and friendly, could have had a better knowledge of the area instead of relying on computers to get all of their information. If you are not traveling with a computer be prepared to use one in the lobby with no privacy. The internet works well but does seem to be throttled, takes a long time to upload photos. Right on the interstate but couldn't hear traffic at all. There is a dog park just across the street and a large shopping area across the interstate. Would stay here again if returned to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: peter s
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while at spring training so did not spend a ton of time in the room. Room was clean but did have slight smell when first entered the room. Turned on fan and smell went away quickly. Only other issue was some holes in the window screen but not a big deal. Breakfast was very nice. Staff very friendly. Let us have a late checkout. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: vate69
Reviews.Content: I really appreciated the spacious and clean suite I got assigned. Simple but comfortable. The beds are comfy and firm. The staff was very polite. Breakfast is just ok and the breakfast room a bit gloomy. Definitely would try to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, and probably even less. Not a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Holden20777
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy. Beds were NOT comfortable. In 6 night stay didn't get a good night's sleep. HVAC has issues. Warm never got cool, and it was NOVEMBER. had to wake up clerk one morning to open breakfast room. Two juices were not working. Poorly maintained breakfast on weekend. Will NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Concept”
Reviews.Author: step12dude
Reviews.Content: Room was a studio with a large bed, sitting area, and kitchenette - very clean and well maintained. The bed was comfortable; room was efficient. Ample space to spread out and ample space to work. Internet access worked fine. This was just an overnight stay, so I really didn't need the kitchenette, but had I needed to stay for any length of time, the kitchenette would have been welcome. Good value for the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good property and location, Not-so-great customer service”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: I chose this property for my week-long trip to Phoenix since I had two Marriot reward nights I needed to use. I was willing to pay for the other 5 nights. For the reward points booking done online, I was offered a one-bed-suite. For the other 5 nights, I booked a studio (Rate was $69/night, which is high for peak-summer in Phoenix) For the paid nights, I was hoping for an upgrade since I am a Silver Marriot member and also the fact that I was already checked-in to a one-bed suite. After first two nights, the manager at front desk asked for another $10/night if I wanted to continue in the one-bed suite, else move to a Studio! I ended up paying $79 / night for 5 nights in peak summer. I guess Manger’s philosophy:: Down economy = try for higher margins from every customer coming your way I wrote about my experience in a Marriot customer survey request sent to me, but no response.

Reviews.Title: “baseball tournament”
Reviews.Author: azmike88
Reviews.Content: the good: the two bedroom suite had a nice layout. one large bedroom with queen bed, a smaller bedroom with queen bed. couch folds out to a queen bed. bathroom sink seperate from tub/toilet. full kitchen apartment size fridge/stove microwave and dishwasher. plates cups silverware dishwasher soap all provided. more like a two bedroom apartment. excellent for an extended stay. three large flat screen tv's, dinin table and chairs. these largewr rooms are located in the corners of the two buildings. 4 windows. wife used the laundry machines and they worked fine. teenager used the gym and it was fine. pool looked clean and people were enjoying it in january. the bad: dont plan on eating breakfast there unless you eat like a bird and you like bread. one of the worst breakfast i have ever seen especially from a major chain hotel. plenty of places to eat nearby. located across the freeway from amusement park, which had a concert late at night, yes you could hear it for free in the room. this hotel is two buildings seperated by a parking lot. they had one ice machine located in the office. byo ice bucket because they dont have any. for just over 100 dollars a night you get lots of room if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice, Clean, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4Bizness
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for two years while on business in Phoenix. I stayed in a studio suite and wasn't disappointed with anything. The room was clean and spacious and had a sofa where i could watch tv without having to be on the bed. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating and the hotel is close to the mall and several restaurants. it's also located directly off the freeway which made it easy to find. The only things that could use improvement is the breakfast selection. Their sister hotel (Springhill Suites) located next door has a much better selection.

Reviews.Title: “Both pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: TeresaupstateNY
Reviews.Content: I usually like Marriott properties, and was prepared to like this one. It's very clean, the bed was perfect, linens smooth and clean, room layout great. The desk was fine for working, and was well lit. The price was a very good $90.00 a night with taxes. It was very hard to get to, with one-way streets, and it was behind another Marriott, a Springhill Suites. We had even downloaded the directions from the hotel's website. After circling all over the place in the dark, we broke a few traffic laws and got in. The breakfast was a disaster, having run out of even the most basic foods, like coffee, oatmeal, toast, yogurt. There was no attendant in the breakfast room, and no one at the front desk. We had no time to go searching for a restaurant, as we had to get to our workplace. Strangest of all was that there was extremely hot water in the toilet, running constantly, and creating steam and stuffiness in the whole room! We've never had that happen before in a hotel, or anywhere, for that matter. The walls were thin, and we could hear our neighbor's TV and banging around in the kitchenette. Perhaps this hotel is having staffing (and plumbing!) problems right now, but there are probably lots of better hotels for business trips to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sylvia1963
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean, the only thind that i was expecting was for the pool to be located in a different site. It was out in the back and was not very clean, and no shade with the horrible heat.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training Greatness”
Reviews.Author: 4444man
Reviews.Content: I came down for some spring training games and stayed here. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If i come to Phoenix next year I'll definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hotel_critic21
Reviews.Content: Came in town for an event at the University of Pheonix stadium and just wanted something somewhat nearby. Towneplace Suites not only delivered exactly what I was looking for, but their staff was exceptionally friendly. Being in the hotel industry myself I am always critiqueing every aspect of a hotel when I stay with them. I was genuinely impressed. I sat with the front desk agent for nearly 20 minutes questioning the town's safer areas as well as good places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay At Again”
Reviews.Author: froggerWI
Reviews.Content: Located along major interstate on a frontage. Nearby intersections can be confusing until you get used to them. Nicely set back from road. Stayed in a studio room with full kitchenette, pull-out sofa and in-room data center. Upholstered furniture looked quite worn and could stand to be replaced soon. Mattress was comfortable. AC unit and refrigerator were loud when running. Easy internet connection and many outlets for charging devices. Bathroom has great shower--with showerhead up high (great for us taller people, no slouching down to wash hair!), great pressure, temperature and water softness. Vanity is medium in size but plenty of drawer space is available in bathroom. Two large mirrors in bathroom, no other mirrors located in room. Continental breakfast served: coffee, cereal, fresh fruit, waffles, oatmeal, grits, yogurt, juice, milk, bread for toast and pastries. Computer with internet connection available in lobby with printer for patron's use--great for flight check-in and printing boarding passes. There was a workout room, but we didn't use it. The pool is outdoor. Friendly, helpful front desk staff that speaks English and Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for value and location”
Reviews.Author: moliver21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Towneplace Suites due to attending the Western National Softball Tournament hosted in Phoenix, AR. We were impressed by the cleanliness of all of the suites and the overall comfort that we enjoyed while staying at this property for 6 nights. The staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to help us with every little detail that we needed support with. They also hosted a barbeque at the pool for the quests and it was just what we needed after playing softball in the Arizona heat. One morning our girls needed to be at a game prior to the morning breakfast time and the desk attendant was generous enough to help us get enough breakfast items together to feed our 14 girls a breakfast that was terrific. There were a few difficulties in some of the rooms but they were remedied quickly and with a smile. The only complaint was the room keys would not work all of the time and daily needed to be redone to enter the buildings and rooms. It is a quiet, nice property, and close to everything that you might need, if I ever return to Phoenix I would definetly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel -- clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: heyheyyu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the Phoenix Metro area...which is a mall across I-17. Lots of chain restaurants in the area. Rooms are clean and decent. Good value for your money. Breakfast is something else to be desired. Very basic continental breakfast. I've stayed at Holiday Inn Express and their breakfast is much better. Service is wonderful! The front desk staff very helpful and very accommodating...all with a smile. I usually come to Phoenix once every quarter and stay for 7 days for work and I always stay at this hotel. Nice to have a little kitchen and friendly service. Some of the front desk even recognize me each time.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treat!”
Reviews.Author: Naturak
Reviews.Content: The manager has a great front desk staff. The women we dealt with were attentive, friendly and helpful. In particular, Chelsea went out of her way to talk to us and make sure our stay in Phoenix was an enjoyable one. The hotel has a great free breakfast and large eating area. The pool area is adjacent to the parking lot and by no means luxurious. However, the rooms are Marriott. Clean ,comfortable and quiet. It is far enough from the I17 to allow you to sleep with the windows open (yes they open) although I would ask for a 2nd or 3rd floor room not facing the pool.

Reviews.Title: “On Point”
Reviews.Author: its_tam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 4 weeks for work and I was pretty impressed. Since I stay in extended stay types hotel this one hit the spot! Normally rates are about $131 but because I booked thru an online service it was only $96. However, the real highlight seeing how eating out can get expensive, is that the hotel had an oven! So yes, I could bake a pizza or cookies, even a baked chicken!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal for families!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasDad
Reviews.Content: We have two small kids, 6 and 4. Though it's a tad on the small side, the 2br suite was perfect for our needs. The cost was the same or less than the price of two rooms at similar nearby hotels and has the added convenience of having the kids within the same secured space. The place was clean, the kitchenette with full fridge/freezer and microwave was a good place for snacks&drinks. There are also a stove, oven, and dishwasher which we didn't use. TV has both Nickelodeon and Cartoon Network so mom & dad can sleep a little extra. We stayed 4 nights and had maid service daily. Breakfast was the usual complimentary fare accompanied by a belgian waffle iron which the kids loved. TV in the dining room is set to CNN, so some discretion on seat location may be required. There is a small but serviceable pool. We didn't bring suits because we thought it would be too cool to swim. The daytime temps ~80F found a number of people in the water and their lips weren't blue, so it must be OK. The lobby computer is another great convenience for tourist info, maps (gotta find the local Starbucks!!!), and staying in touch if you must. Staff was very friendly. We got the usual no hablo Ingles from housekeeping, but the front desk was able to communicate our needs without delay. We hadn't stayed at a TownePlace before, but we will definitely look for them in other destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Shanno497
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night out, and when I saw it was a TownePlace Suites I was a little aprehensive. The office is a little hard to find and not very well marked, but the staff was friendly and helpful. The pool has an open bar fence so you can see it from the parking lot, and from what I could tell the pool was clean but not very big. There seemed to be enough tables and chairs for lounging. You have to use your key to get into the building where the rooms are, so very secure feeling in the middle of a big city. The room was very clean and nice smelling and very roomy. The shower/tub was nice and big, with fast hot water. Good breakfast with waffels, fruit, cereal, bagels, and of all things biscuits and gravy! The staff restocked the breakfast goods fairly promptly. Overall I was very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot. Disapointing service. Little long in the tooth.”
Reviews.Author: Ultimatetravelking
Reviews.Content: The two young men running the desk when I checked in at night were too busy being goofs to take care of the customer. They had no interest in providing service. The second evening I was there, I stood at the check in desk for 10 minutes to buy a bottled water. The two same young men were having such a good time together in the back room that I had no one to pay and finally gave up. The rooms are a little long in the tooth. They are okay but not what you would expect from a Marriott property. The young woman running the desk in the morning was attentive. She went out of her way to be nice to the guests. What a difference between the day shift and the night shift. My advice; if you must stay here, check in early and check out early and avoid the two BOZOs!!!

HotelInfo.Name: TownePlace Suites Phoenix Metrocenter Mall
HotelInfo.Address: 9425 North Black Canyon Freeway, Phoenix, AZ 85021
